Surprise.definition: a condition or situation in which a party to a proceeding is unexpectedly placed without any fault or neglect of his or her own and that entitles the party to relief

1.definition: a condition or situation in which a party to a proceeding is unexpectedly placed without any fault or neglect of his or her own and that entitles the party to relief (as a new trial)

2.definition: an aspect of procedural unconscionability that consists of hiding a term of a contract in a mass of text
